sharedTexts.name: Nombre

reply.label: Contestar
reply.text: Bot will send commands responses as reply

sharedTexts.setDefaultSettings: Are you sure you want to set default settings?
sharedTexts.placeCursorMessage: Place the cursor after "$" to change the variable

deleteConfirmation.text: ¿Está Usted seguro de borrar esta cosa?

haveNoAccess.title: Sin acceso
haveNoAccess.description: You are not authorized to this, ask the broadcaster to provide it.

pageNotFound.title: 404 Página no encontrada
pageNotFound.description: Usted sabe que la vida siempre es ridícula.

validations.empty: Se requiere el nombre del comando.
validations.startsWith: El nombre del comando no debe iniciar con '!'
validations.len: Nombre del comando debe tener menos de 25 caracteres.

gameCategories.label: Activar comando sólo en ciertas categorías (dejar vacío para desactivar)

expiration.label: Expiración
expiration.defaultWarning: No se puede establecer la caducidad para el comando predeterminado

responses.description: Esta es su respuesta de comando. Puede Usted utilizar tales variables de comando como {0}

validations.empty: La respuesta no debe estar vacía. El comando se puede crear sin una respuesta, por lo que puede Usted omitir este campo.
validations.len: La respuesta debe tener menos de 500 caracteres.

responses.defaultWarning: Las respuestas no se pueden editar para los comandos predeterminados.

permissions.name: Roles
permissions.placeholder: Seleccione Usted roles para conceder permisos para utilizar comandos.
permissions.deniedUsers: Usuarios que no pueden utilizar ese comando.
permissions.allowedUsers: Usuarios que pueden omitir la restricción de roles para ese comando.

restrictions.name: Restricciones por estadísticas
restrictions.watchTime: Tiempo de observación requerido para utilizar ese comando.
restrictions.messages: Recuento de mensajes requerido para utilizar ese comando.
restrictions.channelsPoints: Se requieren puntos de canales usados para utilizar ese comando.

visible.label: Visibilidad
visible.text: Visibilidad de comandos en una página de lista de comandos públicos.

keepOrder.label: Mantenga el orden
keepOrder.text: El bot mantendrá este orden de respuestas al enviarlas al chat.

onlineOnly.label: Solo cuando está en línea.
onlineOnly.text: Este comando sólo funcionará cuando la secuencia esté en línea.

offlineOnly.label: Sólo cuando está sin conexión.
offlineOnly.text: Este comando sólo funcionará cuando la secuencia esté sin conexión.

alert.label: Seleccione Usted una alerta, que se activará cuando el comando  esté utilizado.

header.channelsAccess: Canales a los que tiene Usted acceso

botManage.title: El estado del bot
botManage.success: Activado y tiene el estado de moderador.
botManage.notEnabledTitle: El bot no está habilitado en el canal.
botManage.notModerator: Hemos encontrado que el bot no es un moderador en este canal. Por favor, use {0}, de lo contrario el bot no enviará mensajes en el chat y la mayoría de las funciones no funcionarán.

streamInfo.noTitle: ¡No se puede obtener el título del Stream!
streamInfo.title: Título del Stream

integrations.songServicesInfo: Proporcionar acceso a este servicio permite a Twir obtener e imprimir automáticamente su canción que se está reproduciendo actualmente en el chat cuando se está utilizando el comando {0}
integrations.donateServicesInfo: Proporcionar acceso a este servicio permite a Twir escuchar las donaciones entrantes y establecerá interacciones para usted en las categorías {0}, {1}

discord.description: Proporcionar acceso a Discord permite a Twir configurar pings automáticos y alertas sobre el estado de la transmisión en sus servidores de Discord.

alerts.label: Alertas
alerts.showProfileImage: ¿Mostrar el Avatar del perfil de Twitch?
alerts.streamOnlinePlaceholder: Este mensaje Twir se enviará cuando se inicie el Stream.
alerts.streamOfflinePlaceholder: Este mensaje Twir se enviará cuando el Stream se desconecte.
alerts.updateAlert: Twir actualizará el mensaje incrustado periódicamente para asegurarse de que esté sincronizado con su estado de Stream.
alerts.shouldDeleteMessageOnOffline: ¿Eliminar el mensaje de alerta en lugar de editarlo cuando el Stream se desconecta?
alerts.additionalUsersIdsForLiveCheck: Lista adicional de usuarios de Twitch a seguir para enviar alertas de Stream.

discord.cannotSendMessage: Bot no tiene la capacidad de enviar mensajes en ese canal. Echa un vistazo a los permisos del canal para resolverlo.

faceit.info: Proporcionar acceso a este servicio permite a Twir rastrear tus coincidencias de Faceit y configurará variables de comando como {0}, {1} y mucho más.

nightbot.info: Proporcionar acceso a este servicio permite a Twir importar comandos y temporizadores de Nightbot.

valorant.info: Proporcionar acceso a este servicio permite a Twir rastrear sus coincidencias de Valorant y configurará variables de comandos como {0}, {1} y mucho más.

sevenTv.description: Podemos gestionar emotes de canal 7tv, cuando esta integración está habilitada
sevenTv.alert: También puede realizar flujos avanzados a través del sistema {0} para gestionar los emotes de 7tv.
sevenTv.errorSameReward: ¡No puedes usar la misma recompensa para agregar y eliminar emotes!
sevenTv.deleteOnlyAddedByApp: Eliminar los emotes solo agregados por Twir

connectSteps.step2: Haga clic en el botón "Agregar editores"

sevenTv.rewardSelectorDescription: Debes crear recompensa con entrada. Los usuarios deben usar el enlace 7tv para emote cuando activan la recompensa.

obs.warningTitle: You need to configure OBS first before proceeding further!
obs.warningText: Seems like you have not connected Twir with OBS. You can do it on the “Overlays” page.

filters.label: Filters
filters.description: You can filter events by specific conditions. For example if you use "{'{raidViewers}'} equals 10" on raid event, it will trigger operation only when raiders amount is 10.

variables.pollWinnerChannelsPointsVotes: Number of Winner's Channel Points Votes

predictionWinner.title: Prediction Winner Outcome
predictionWinner.totalPoints: Total Channel Points Placed on Winner Outcome

variables.banEndsInMinutes: Timeout (in minutes, or set to "permanent" to ban permamently)

overlays.noAccess: You do not have access to this overlay!
overlays.copied: Successfully copied overlay link URL! You need to set this as browser source in OBS.

nowPlaying.description: Overlay with current playable song information. This overlay will work only if you have connected your song service integration like spotify, lastfm.

tts.description: This overlay allows you to play chat messages as audio through OBS with the set of preconfigured voices. You can control this overlay using commands or events.
tts.eventsHint: Hint: You can use events system to trigger TTS on specific event.
tts.allowUsersChooseVoice: Allow chatters to use different voices?
tts.doNotReadTwitchEmotes: Do Not Read Twitch Emotes (including 7TV, FFZ, BTTV

users.empty: No one have created their own customizations yet...

tts.previewText: Preview voice with text, pitch and rate:

obs.description: This overlay allows you to connect Twir with your OBS. It gives an ability to manage your sources, scenes, audio sources and events.

alerts.description: This overlay allows you to play configured alerts from the “Alerts” section.

chat.directionWarning: To use 'Left' and 'Right' you should set overlay height up to 50x for the chat to display properly!
chat.description: This overlay allows you to display your Twitch chat in your streaming software (such as OBS, XSplit, etc).)

dudes.description: Animated characters for chatters in your stream
dudes.nameBoxFillGradientStopsError: Text colors of gradient range should be from 0 to 1

kappagen.description: This overlay allows you to fill up your screen with explosions, movements, fireworks, walls of emotes through the chat.
kappagen.info: Spawn will show emotes on screen while users just chatting around and sending emotes. Kappagen will show configured amount of emotes on a command or configured events.

settings.spawn: Spawn an emote on each chat message?

brb.description: This overlay allows you to show a countdown on screen for specific events or while you're AFK.

startCommand.example:
!brb 1 Coffee – starts an 1-minute timer with 'Coffee' label.
!brb 1 – starts an 1-minute timer with default text specified in the Settings and Post-Timer Settings sections.

player.title: Current Song
player.noAccess: Seems, that you are not able to listen songs there... Go to your own dashboard Song Requests to access the player.

settings.playerNoCookieModeDescription: Enabling this option will allow you to listen to songs without cookies and viewing history. Need refresh page after enabling.
settings.deniedChannels: Banned YouTube Channels List (from requesting songs)
settings.deniedWords: Banned Word List (affects both titles and YouTube channel names)
settings.takeSongFromDonationMessage: Attempt to get song links from donation messages?
settings.confirmClearQueue: Are you sure you want to clear the queue?

ban.userConfirm: Are you sure you want to ban this user?
ban.songConfirm: Are you sure you want to ban this song?

modal.timelineDescription: Each response will be sent once both interval conditions is met.

keywords.title: Keywords

info.text: Keywords helps you to trigger chat message on certain words matching.

keywords.regularDescription: Regular Expression should be written in golang format! See {0} here.

variables.title: Variables
variables.info: Variables is a type of a context that can be used in bot responses, commands and other parts of the bot. You can specify a constant value or put a script to get some values that is usually cannot be easily accessed by the bot. Script Variables are recommended for advanced users.

info.title: Greetings Information
info.text: Greetings are a type of messages that bot uses to welcome known stream viewers when they send their first message in chat on each stream. If you wish to greet every user in chat, then you can look at the events category instead of Greetings.

alerts.title: Alerts
alerts.overlayLabel: Alerts are a graphical part of the command or event implementation. You can configure an alert with specified audio, image and text, then assign it to specific command, event, keyword or greeting. Also do not forget to insert overlay URL as a browser source into your streaming software scene! (such as OBS, XSplit, etc.)
alerts.name: Name

validations.name: Name cannot be empty or longer than 30 symbols!

8ball.description: A simple chat game that allows chatters to ask the magic 8ball something and it will answer to the chatter.

russianRoulette.description: A simple chat game that allows chatters to test luck in a classic russian funny* roulette game.
russianRoulette.canBeUsedByModerator: Timeout Moderators? *Moderator privileges will be granted again after the timeout.
russianRoulette.timeoutSeconds: Timeout Time (in seconds, set it to 0 to disable a timeout)

duel.title: Duels
duel.description: A simple chat game between two users allowing to test their dodge skills!

start.title: Initial Message
start.description: Sends this message when duel initiated. Available variables: {'{target}, {initiator}, {duelAcceptCommandName}, {acceptSeconds}'}

result.title: Result Message
result.description: Sends this message when duel happened. Available variables: {'{loser}, {winner}'}

bothDie.title: «No One Survived» Message
bothDie.description: Sends this message when duel happened and both duelists are dead. Available variables: {'{target}, {initiator}'}

settings.title: Settings
settings.bothDiePercent: Percent of chance both users die

seppuku.description: Seppuku, is a form of Japanese ritualistic suicide by disembowelment.

voteban.description: Commence jury trial of the guilty chatterer!

enabled.label: Enabled
enabled.description: Enable chat translation for your channel

targetLanguage.label: Target Language
targetLanguage.description: Messages will be translated to this language

excludedLanguages.label: Excluded Languages
excludedLanguages.description: Messages in these languages will not be translated

excludedUsers.title: Excluded Users
excludedUsers.description: Messages from these users will not be translated

reset.label: Reset stats
reset.resetQuestion: Are you sure you want to reset {title}?

overlaysRegistry.description: This category allows you to create custom configurable overlays for OBS. Currently only HTML Overlays are supported, but other overlay variants will be added later. Thank you for the patience. <3

noLayersCreated.title: Not Configured
noLayersCreated.description: Currently layers of overlays not created

overlaysRegistry.name: Overlay Name

validations.name: Overlay Name cannot be empty and longer than 30 symbols!
validations.layers: Layers cannot be empty! This overlay cannot contain more than 15 layers.

html.description: Allows you to use custom HTML, CSS and bot variables.

variablesAlert.title: You can use bot variables in HTML, click on the list below to show available options.
variablesAlert.selectToCopy: Select a required variable. It will be automatically copied to the clipboard.

html.periodicallyRefetchData: Periodically parse and update HTML data from server?

chatAlerts.randomedMessage: If there are several variants of the chat alerts, then they will be picked randomly.
chatAlerts.randomMessageWithCount: If there will be several variants with the same counter number, then they will be picked randomly.
chatAlerts.replacedInfo: Available Variables: {vars}. They will be replaced with the actual information in the alert.

ban.alertInfo: Set time to 0 to print a message when the user is permanently banned.

moderation.name: Name of rule, just for your convenience to see name in list
moderation.excludedRoles: Select roles which won't be impacted by this filter:

links.name: Links
links.description: Scans Twitch chat for any web links or URLs and promptly removes them to prevent spam or unsafe content from being sent into chat.

deny_list.name: Disallowed Words List
deny_list.description: Helps to maintain clean chat by filtering out words or phrases specified in a predefined list, preventing them from being displayed.
deny_list.empty: List of disallowed words is empty! You can add one there.
deny_list.regexp: If you are an advanced user, Disallowed Words List also support regular expressions. Regular Expression should be written in golang format! See {0} here.

wordBoundary.label: Word boundary
wordBoundary.description: A word boundary in filtering marks the start or end of a word, ensuring filters match whole words (e.g., "cat") but not parts of words (e.g., "category").

caseSensitive.label: Case sensitive
caseSensitive.description: Case sensitivity in filtering means that the filter will only match words with the exact same capitalization as the filter (e.g., "Cat" will not match "cat").

symbols.name: Symbols
symbols.description: Identifies and restricts excessive use of symbols, preventing clutter, chaos and maintaining readability in the chat.

long_message.name: Message Length
long_message.description: Identifies and restricts long messages by limiting the length of messages sent into chat.

caps.name: Caps
caps.description: Identifies and restricts excessive use of capital letters, promoting a more balanced and respectful conversation in the chat.

emotes.name: Emotes
emotes.description: Detects the frequency and amount of emoticons used in messages, avoiding overuse and spam of them.

language.name: Language
language.description: Scans and filters out inappropriate languages.

one_man_spam.name: One Man Spam
one_man_spam.description: Detects and restricts users who are spamming the chat with a lot of messages in a short period of time.
one_man_spam.triggerLength: Minimal message length to trigger storing and filtering
one_man_spam.minimumStoredMessages: Number of stored messages to begin filter
one_man_spam.messageMemorySeconds: How long to store user message in seconds
one_man_spam.maxPercentage: Max text similarity percentage. Levenshtein distance used for calculation.

feedback.rateLimited: You are sending messages to quickly, try again in {time}

account.title: Account
account.showMeOnLanding: Show yourself on the Landing Page?

regenerateApiKey.info: This key is used for all overlays links. When you regenerate it, you need to check all your overlays in your streaming software and replace URLs with the new links.

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.confirmResetForm: Are you sure you want to reset the form?

dangerZone.title: Danger Zone
dangerZone.revokeAllSessionsDescription: All user sessions will be revoked
dangerZone.revokeAllSessionsConfirm: Are you sure you want to revoke all sessions?

expiringVips.title: Scheduled VIPs

description.line1: With this feature you can create VIPs for your channel, which will be removed after selected time.
description.line2: You can use commands from built-in {module} module for that.

expiringVips.comingSoon: Soon, but already available through commands

commands.setExpire: Extend expiring time for existing timed VIP, or add expiration for some VIP user

alert.title: Heads up!
alert.description: It's a list of expiring VIPs, not list of all channel VIPs.

description.line1: Create rules to moderate your chat.
Mass ban/delete/timeout messages that contains specific phrase.
description.line2: Improper usage may result in a permanent ban you in TwirApp service.

createDialog.title: Create New Giveaway
createDialog.description: Enter a keyword for your giveaway. Users will use this keyword to participate.

notifications.createdDescription: Giveaway with keyword "{keyword}" has been created

currentGiveaway.selectWinner: Select a winner to view their chat logs and profile
